member.summary: ConnectionConfiguration allows you to control how ElasticLowLevelClient behaves and where/how it connects to elasticsearch

member.summary:
The default predicate for implementations that return true for
in which case master only nodes are excluded from API calls.

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.ConnectionConfiguration`1.DefaultSerializer(`0)
member.summary: The default serializer used to serialize documents to and from JSON

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.ConnectionConfiguration`1.EnableTcpKeepAlive(System.TimeSpan,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary:
Sets the keep-alive option on a TCP connection.
For Desktop CLR, sets ServicePointManager.SetTcpKeepAlive
member.param: Specifies the timeout with no activity until the first keep-alive packet is sent.
Specifies the interval between when successive keep-alive packets are sent if no acknowledgement is received.

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.ConnectionConfiguration`1.MaximumRetries(System.Int32)
member.summary: The maximum number of retries for a given request,

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.ConnectionConfiguration`1.ConnectionLimit(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Limits the number of concurrent connections that can be opened to an endpoint. Defaults to 80.
For Desktop CLR, this setting applies to the DefaultConnectionLimit property on the ServicePointManager object when creating ServicePoint objects, affecting the default implementation.
For Core CLR, this setting applies to the MaxConnectionsPerServer property on the HttpClientHandler instances used by the HttpClient inside the default implementation
member.param: The connection limit, a value lower then 0 will cause the connection limit not to be set at all

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.ConnectionConfiguration`1.SniffOnConnectionFault(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables resniffing of the cluster when a call fails, if the connection pool supports reseeding. Defaults to true

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.ConnectionConfiguration`1.SniffOnStartup(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables sniffing on first usage of a connection pool if that pool supports reseeding. Defaults to true

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.ConnectionConfiguration`1.SniffLifeSpan(System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan})
member.summary: Set the duration after which a cluster state is considered stale and a sniff should be performed again. An has to signal it supports reseeding, otherwise sniffing will never happen. Defaults to 1 hour. Set to null to disable completely. Sniffing will only ever happen on ConnectionPools that return true for SupportsReseeding
member.param: The duration a clusterstate is considered fresh, set to null to disable periodic sniffing

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.ConnectionConfiguration`1.EnableHttpCompression(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Enables gzip compressed requests and responses.
IMPORTANT: You need to configure http compression on Elasticsearch to be able to use this
http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/modules-http.html

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.ConnectionConfiguration`1.DisableAutomaticProxyDetection(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Disables the automatic detection of a proxy

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.ConnectionConfiguration`1.ThrowExceptions(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Instead of following a c/go like error checking on response.IsValid always throw an exception on the client when a call resulted in an exception on either the client or the Elasticsearch server.
Reasons for such exceptions could be search parser errors, index missing exceptions, etc...

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.ConnectionConfiguration`1.DisablePing(System.Boolean)
member.summary: When a node is used for the very first time or when it's used for the first time after it has been marked dead a ping with a very low timeout is send to the node to make sure that when it's still dead it reports it as fast as possible. You can disable these pings globally here if you rather have it fail on the possible slower original request

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.ConnectionConfiguration`1.GlobalQueryStringParameters(System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection)
member.summary: A collection of query string parameters that will be sent with every request. Useful in situations where you always need to pass a parameter e.g. an API key.

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.ConnectionConfiguration`1.GlobalHeaders(System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection)
member.summary: A collection of headers that will be sent with every request. Useful in situations where you always need to pass a header e.g. a custom auth header

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.ConnectionConfiguration`1.RequestTimeout(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary:
Sets the default timeout in milliseconds for each request to Elasticsearch. Defaults to 60 seconds.
NOTE: You can set this to a high value here, and specify a timeout on Elasticsearch's side.
member.param: time out in milliseconds

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.ConnectionConfiguration`1.PingTimeout(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Sets the default ping timeout in milliseconds for ping requests, which are used to determine whether a node is alive. Pings should fail as fast as possible.
member.param: The ping timeout in milliseconds defaults to 1000, or 2000 if using SSL.

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.ConnectionConfiguration`1.DeadTimeout(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Sets the default dead timeout factor when a node has been marked dead.
member.remarks: Some connection pools may use a flat timeout whilst others take this factor and increase it exponentially

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.ConnectionConfiguration`1.MaxDeadTimeout(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Sets the maximum time a node can be marked dead. Different implementations of may choose a different default.
member.param: The timeout in milliseconds

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.ConnectionConfiguration`1.MaxRetryTimeout(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary:
Limits the total runtime, including retries, separately from
When not specified, defaults to , which itself defaults to 60 seconds

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.ConnectionConfiguration`1.Proxy(System.Uri,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: If your connection has to go through proxy, use this method to specify the proxy url

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.ConnectionConfiguration`1.PrettyJson(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Forces all requests to have ?pretty=true querystring parameter appended, causing Elasticsearch to return formatted JSON. Also forces the client to send out formatted JSON. Defaults to false

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.ConnectionConfiguration`1.IncludeServerStackTraceOnError(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Forces all requests to have ?error_trace=true querystring parameter appended, causing Elasticsearch to return stack traces as part of serialized exceptions Defaults to false

member.summary:
Ensures the response bytes are always available on the
IMPORTANT: Depending on the registered serializer, this may cause the response to be buffered in memory first, potentially affecting performance.

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.ConnectionConfiguration`1.OnRequestCompleted(System.Action{Elasticsearch.Net.IApiCallDetails})
member.summary: Registers an that is called when a response is received from Elasticsearch. This can be useful for implementing custom logging. Multiple callbacks can be registered by calling this multiple times

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.ConnectionConfiguration`1.OnRequestDataCreated(System.Action{Elasticsearch.Net.RequestData})
member.summary: Registers an that is called when is created. Multiple callbacks can be registered by calling this multiple times

member.summary: Basic Authentication credentials to send with all requests to Elasticsearch

member.summary:
Allows for requests to be pipelined. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTTP_pipelining
NOTE: HTTP pipelining must also be enabled in Elasticsearch for this to work properly.

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.ConnectionConfiguration`1.NodePredicate(System.Func{Elasticsearch.Net.Node,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Register a predicate to select which nodes that you want to execute API calls on. Note that sniffing requests omit this predicate and always execute on all nodes. When using an implementation that supports reseeding of nodes, this will default to omitting master only node from regular API calls. When using static or single node connection pooling it is assumed the list of node you instantiate the client with should be taken verbatim.
member.param: Return true if you want the node to be used for API calls

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.ConnectionConfiguration`1.EnableDebugMode(System.Action{Elasticsearch.Net.IApiCallDetails})
member.summary: Turns on settings that aid in debugging like DisableDirectStreaming() and PrettyJson() so that the original request and response JSON can be inspected. It also always asks the server for the full stack trace on errors
member.param: An optional callback to be performed when the request completes. This will not overwrite the global OnRequestCompleted callback that is set directly on ConnectionSettings. If no callback is passed, DebugInformation from the response will be written to the debug output by default.

member.summary: Register a ServerCertificateValidationCallback, this is called per endpoint until it returns true. After this callback returns true that endpoint is validated for the lifetime of the ServiceEndpoint for that host.

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.CertificateValidations.AllowAll(System.Object,System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate,System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Chain,System.Net.Security.SslPolicyErrors)
member.summary: DANGEROUS, never use this in production validates ALL certificates to true.
member.returns: Always true, allowing ALL certificates

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.CertificateValidations.DenyAll(System.Object,System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate,System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Chain,System.Net.Security.SslPolicyErrors)
member.summary: Always false, in effect blocking ALL certificates
member.returns: Always false, always blocking ALL certificates

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.CertificateValidations.AuthorityPartOfChain(System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate,System.Boolean,System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509RevocationMode)
member.summary: Helper to create a certificate validation callback based on the certificate authority certificate that we used to generate the nodes certificates with. This callback expects the CA to be part of the chain as intermediate CA.
member.param: The ca certificate used to generate the nodes certificate

Custom CA are never trusted by default unless they are in the machines trusted store, set this to true if you've added the CA to the machines trusted store. In which case UntrustedRoot should not be accepted.
By default we do not check revocation, it is however recommended to check this (either offline or online).

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.CertificateValidations.AuthorityIsRoot(System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate,System.Boolean,System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509RevocationMode)
member.summary: Helper to create a certificate validation callback based on the certificate authority certificate that we used to generate the nodes certificates with. This callback does NOT expect the CA to be part of the chain presented by the server. Including the root certificate in the chain increases the SSL handshake size and Elasticsearch's certgen by default does not include the CA in the certificate chain.
member.param: The ca certificate used to generate the nodes certificate

Custom CA are never trusted by default unless they are in the machines trusted store, set this to true if you've added the CA to the machines trusted store. In which case UntrustedRoot should not be accepted.
By default we do not check revocation, it is however recommended to check this (either offline or online).

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.BulkRequestParameters.WaitForActiveShards
member.summary: Sets the number of shard copies that must be active before proceeding with the bulk operation. Defaults to 1, meaning the primary shard only. Set to `all` for all shard copies, otherwise set to any non-negative value less than or equal to the total number of copies for the shard (number of replicas + 1)

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.BulkRequestParameters.Refresh
member.summary: If `true` then refresh the effected shards to make this operation visible to search, if `wait_for` then wait for a refresh to make this operation visible to search, if `false` (the default) then do nothing with refreshes.

member.summary: Default document type for items which don't provide one

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.DeleteByQueryRequestParameters.Version
member.summary: Specify whether to return document version as part of a hit

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.DeleteByQueryRequestParameters.RequestCache
member.summary: Specify if request cache should be used for this request or not, defaults to index level setting

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.DeleteByQueryRequestParameters.Refresh
member.summary: Should the effected indexes be refreshed?

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.DeleteByQueryRequestParameters.Timeout
member.summary: Time each individual bulk request should wait for shards that are unavailable.

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.DeleteByQueryRequestParameters.WaitForActiveShards
member.summary: Sets the number of shard copies that must be active before proceeding with the delete by query operation. Defaults to 1, meaning the primary shard only. Set to `all` for all shard copies, otherwise set to any non-negative value less than or equal to the total number of copies for the shard (number of replicas + 1)

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.DeleteByQueryRequestParameters.ScrollSize
member.summary: Size on the scroll request powering the delete by query

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.DeleteByQueryRequestParameters.WaitForCompletion
member.summary: Should the request should block until the delete by query is complete.

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.DeleteByQueryRequestParameters.RequestsPerSecond
member.summary: The throttle for this request in sub-requests per second. -1 means no throttle.

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.DeleteByQueryRequestParameters.Slices
member.summary: The number of slices this task should be divided into. Defaults to 1 meaning the task isn't sliced into subtasks.

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.DeleteByQueryRethrottleRequestParameters.RequestsPerSecond
member.summary: The throttle to set on this request in floating sub-requests per second. -1 means set no throttle.

member.summary: Specify timeout for connection to master

member.summary: Sets the number of shard copies that must be active before proceeding with the index operation. Defaults to 1, meaning the primary shard only. member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.IndexRequestParameters.Refresh
member.summary: If `true` then refresh the affected shards to make this operation visible to search, if `wait_for` then wait for a refresh to make this operation visible to search, if `false` (the default) then do nothing with refreshes.

member.summary: Explicit version number for concurrency control

Set to `all` for all shard copies, otherwise set to any non-negative value less than or equal to the total number of copies for the shard (number of replicas + 1)

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.UpdateRequestParameters.SourceEnabled
member.summary: True or false to return the _source field or not, or a list of fields to return

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.UpdateRequestParameters.Parent
member.summary: ID of the parent document. Is is only used for routing and when for the upsert request

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.UpdateRequestParameters.Refresh
member.summary: If `true` then refresh the effected shards to make this operation visible to search, if `wait_for` then wait for a refresh to make this operation visible to search, if `false` (the default) then do nothing with refreshes.

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.UpdateRequestParameters.RetryOnConflict
member.summary: Specify how many times should the operation be retried when a conflict occurs (default: 0)

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.UpdateRequestParameters.IfSeqNo
member.summary: only perform the update operation if the last operation that has changed the document has the specified sequence number

member.summary: only perform the update operation if the last operation that has changed the document has the specified primary term

member.summary: Explicit version number for concurrency control

member.summary: The analyzer to use for the query string

member.summary: Specify whether wildcard and prefix queries should be analyzed (default: false)

member.summary: The field to use as default where no field prefix is given in the query string

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.UpdateByQueryRequestParameters.IgnoreUnavailable
member.summary: Whether specified concrete indices should be ignored when unavailable (missing or closed)

member.summary: Whether to ignore if a wildcard indices expression resolves into no concrete indices. (This includes `_all` string or when no indices have been specified)

member.summary: What to do when the update by query hits version conflicts?

member.summary: Whether to expand wildcard expression to concrete indices that are open, closed or both.

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.UpdateByQueryRequestParameters.Lenient
member.summary: Specify whether format-based query failures (such as providing text to a numeric field) should be ignored

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.UpdateByQueryRequestParameters.Pipeline
member.summary: Ingest pipeline to set on index requests made by this action. (default: none)

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.UpdateByQueryRequestParameters.Preference
member.summary: Specify the node or shard the operation should be performed on (default: random)

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.UpdateByQueryRequestParameters.QueryOnQueryString
member.summary: Query in the Lucene query string syntax

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.UpdateByQueryRequestParameters.Routing
member.summary: A comma-separated list of specific routing values

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.UpdateByQueryRequestParameters.Scroll
member.summary: Specify how long a consistent view of the index should be maintained for scrolled search

member.summary: Explicit timeout for each search request. Defaults to no timeout.

member.summary: True or false to return the _source field or not, or a list of fields to return

member.summary: A list of fields to exclude from the returned _source field

member.summary: Specify whether to return document version as part of a hit

member.summary: Specify if request cache should be used for this request or not, defaults to index level setting

member.summary: Should the effected indexes be refreshed?

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.UpdateByQueryRequestParameters.Timeout
member.summary: Time each individual bulk request should wait for shards that are unavailable.

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.UpdateByQueryRequestParameters.WaitForActiveShards
member.summary: Sets the number of shard copies that must be active before proceeding with the update by query operation. Defaults to 1, meaning the primary shard only. Set to `all` for all shard copies, otherwise set to any non-negative value less than or equal to the total number of copies for the shard (number of replicas + 1)

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.UpdateByQueryRequestParameters.ScrollSize
member.summary: Size on the scroll request powering the update by query

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.UpdateByQueryRequestParameters.WaitForCompletion
member.summary: Should the request should block until the update by query operation is complete.

member.summary: The throttle to set on this request in sub-requests per second. -1 means no throttle.

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.UpdateByQueryRequestParameters.Slices
member.summary: The number of slices this task should be divided into. Defaults to 1 meaning the task isn't sliced into subtasks.

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.UpdateByQueryRethrottleRequestParameters.RequestsPerSecond
member.summary: The throttle to set on this request in floating sub-requests per second. -1 means set no throttle.

member.summary: Sets the number of shard copies that must be active before returning. Defaults to 0. Set to `all` for all shard copies, otherwise set to any non-negative value less than or equal to the total number of copies for the shard (number of replicas + 1)

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.IElasticLowLevelClient.DoRequest``1(Elasticsearch.Net.HttpMethod,System.String,Elasticsearch.Net.PostData,Elasticsearch.Net.IRequestParameters)
member.summary: Perform any request you want over the configured IConnection synchronously while taking advantage of the cluster failover.
member.typeparam: The type representing the response JSON
member.param: the HTTP Method to use
The path of the the url that you would like to hit
The body of the request, string and byte[] are posted as is other types will be serialized to JSON
Optionally configure request specific timeouts, headers

member.name: T:Elasticsearch.Net.RecyclableMemoryStream
member.summary: MemoryStream implementation that deals with pooling and managing memory streams which use potentially large buffers.
member.remarks: This class works in tandem with the RecylableMemoryStreamManager to supply MemoryStream objects to callers, while avoiding these specific problems: 1. LOH allocations - since all large buffers are pooled, they will never incur a Gen2 GC 2. Memory waste - A standard memory stream doubles its size when it runs out of room. This leads to continual memory growth as each stream approaches the maximum allowed size. 3. Memory copying - Each time a MemoryStream grows, all the bytes are copied into new buffers. This implementation only copies the bytes when GetBuffer is called. 4. Memory fragmentation - By using homogeneous buffer sizes, it ensures that blocks of memory can be easily reused. The stream is implemented on top of a series of uniformly-sized blocks. As the stream's length grows, additional blocks are retrieved from the memory manager. It is these blocks that are pooled, not the stream object itself. The biggest wrinkle in this implementation is when GetBuffer() is called. This requires a single contiguous buffer. If only a single block is in use, then that block is returned. If multiple blocks are in use, we retrieve a larger buffer from the memory manager. These large buffers are also pooled, split by size--they are multiples of a chunk size (1 MB by default). Once a large buffer is assigned to the stream the blocks are NEVER again used for this stream. All operations take place on the large buffer. The large buffer can be replaced by a larger buffer from the pool as needed. All blocks and large buffers are maintained in the stream until the stream is disposed (unless AggressiveBufferReturn is enabled in the stream manager).

member.name: F:Elasticsearch.Net.RecyclableMemoryStream._blocks
member.summary: All of these blocks must be the same size

member.name: F:Elasticsearch.Net.RecyclableMemoryStream._dirtyBuffers
member.summary: This list is used to store buffers once they're replaced by something larger. This is for the cases where you have users of this class that may hold onto the buffers longer than they should and you want to prevent race conditions which could corrupt the data.

member.name: F:Elasticsearch.Net.RecyclableMemoryStream._largeBuffer
member.summary: This is only set by GetBuffer() if the necessary buffer is larger than a single block size, or on construction if the caller immediately requests a single large buffer.
member.remarks: If this field is non-null, it contains the concatenation of the bytes found in the individual blocks. Once it is created, this (or a larger) largeBuffer will be used for the life of the stream.

member.param: The memory manager
A string identifying this stream for logging and debugging purposes

An initial buffer to use. This buffer will be owned by the stream and returned to the memory manager upon Dispose.

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.RecyclableMemoryStream.CanRead
member.summary: Whether the stream can currently read

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.RecyclableMemoryStream.CanSeek
member.summary: Whether the stream can currently seek

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.RecyclableMemoryStream.CanWrite
member.summary: Whether the stream can currently write

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.RecyclableMemoryStream.Capacity
member.remarks: Capacity is always in multiples of the memory manager's block size, unless the large buffer is in use. Capacity never decreases during a stream's lifetime. Explicitly setting the capacity to a lower value than the current value will have no effect. This is because the buffers are all pooled by chunks and there's little reason to allow stream truncation.

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.RecyclableMemoryStream.Length
member.summary: Gets the number of bytes written to this stream.

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.RecyclableMemoryStream.Position
member.summary: Gets the current position in the stream

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.RecyclableMemoryStream.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for this stream across it's entire lifetime

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.RecyclableMemoryStream.MemoryManager
member.summary: Gets the memory manager being used by this stream.

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.RecyclableMemoryStream.Tag
member.summary: A temporary identifier for the current usage of this stream.

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.RecyclableMemoryStream.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns the memory used by this stream back to the pool.
member.param: Whether we're disposing (true), or being called by the finalizer (false)

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.RecyclableMemoryStream.GetBuffer
member.summary: Returns a single buffer containing the contents of the stream. The buffer may be longer than the stream length.
member.returns: A byte[] buffer
member.remarks: IMPORTANT: Doing a Write() after calling GetBuffer() invalidates the buffer. The old buffer is held onto until Dispose is called, but the next time GetBuffer() is called, a new buffer from the pool will be required.

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.RecyclableMemoryStream.ToArray
member.summary: Returns a new array with a copy of the buffer's contents. You should almost certainly be using GetBuffer combined with the Length to access the bytes in this stream. Calling ToArray will destroy the benefits of pooled buffers, but it is included for the sake of completeness.

member.param: Destination buffer
Offset into buffer at which to start placing the read bytes.
Number of bytes to read.
member.returns: The number of bytes read
member.exception: offset or count is less than 0
offset subtracted from the buffer length is less than count

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.RecyclableMemoryStreamManager.AggressiveBufferReturn
member.summary: Whether dirty buffers can be immediately returned to the buffer pool. E.g. when GetBuffer() is called on a stream and creates a single large buffer, if this setting is enabled, the other blocks will be returned to the buffer pool immediately. Note when enabling this setting that the user is responsible for ensuring that any buffer previously retrieved from a stream which is subsequently modified is not used after modification (as it may no longer be valid).

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.RecyclableMemoryStreamManager.GetStream(System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieve a new MemoryStream object with the given tag and at least the given capacity, possibly using a single continugous underlying buffer.
member.remarks: Retrieving a MemoryStream which provides a single contiguous buffer can be useful in situations where the initial size is known and it is desirable to avoid copying data between the smaller underlying buffers to a single large one. This is most helpful when you know that you will always call GetBuffer on the underlying stream.
member.param: A tag which can be used to track the source of the stream.
The minimum desired capacity for the stream.
Whether to attempt to use a single contiguous buffer.
member.returns: A MemoryStream.

member.remarks: The new stream's position is set to the beginning of the stream when returned.
member.param: A tag which can be used to track the source of the stream.
The byte buffer to copy data from.
The offset from the start of the buffer to copy from.
The number of bytes to copy from the buffer.
member.returns: A MemoryStream.

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.JsonObject.TryConvert(System.Dynamic.ConvertBinder,System.Object@)
member.summary: Provides implementation for type conversion operations. Classes derived from the class can override this method to specify dynamic behavior for operations that convert an object from one type to another.
member.param: Provides information about the conversion operation. The binder.Type property provides the type to which the object must be converted. For example, for the statement (String)sampleObject in C# (CType(sampleObject, Type) in Visual Basic), where sampleObject is an instance of the class derived from the class, binder.Type returns the type. The binder.Explicit property provides information about the kind of conversion that occurs. It returns true for explicit conversion and false for implicit conversion.
The result of the type conversion operation.
member.returns: Alwasy returns true.

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.JsonObject.TryGetIndex(System.Dynamic.GetIndexBinder,System.Object[],System.Object@)
member.summary: Provides the implementation for operations that get a value by index. Classes derived from the class can override this method to specify dynamic behavior for indexing operations.
member.param: Provides information about the operation.

The indexes that are used in the operation. For example, for the sampleObject[3] operation in C# (sampleObject(3) in Visual Basic), where sampleObject is derived from the DynamicObject class, is equal to 3.
The result of the index operation.
member.returns: Alwasy returns true.

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.JsonObject.TryGetMember(System.Dynamic.GetMemberBinder,System.Object@)
member.summary: Provides the implementation for operations that get member values. Classes derived from the class can override this method to specify dynamic behavior for operations such as getting a value for a property.
member.param: Provides information about the object that called the dynamic operation. The binder.Name property provides the name of the member on which the dynamic operation is performed. For example, for the Console.WriteLine(sampleObject.SampleProperty) statement, where sampleObject is an instance of the class derived from the class, binder.Name returns "SampleProperty". The binder.IgnoreCase property specifies whether the member name is case-sensitive.
The result of the get operation. For example, if the method is called for a property, you can assign the property value to .
member.returns: Alwasy returns true.

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.JsonObject.TrySetIndex(System.Dynamic.SetIndexBinder,System.Object[],System.Object)
member.summary: Provides the implementation for operations that set a value by index. Classes derived from the class can override this method to specify dynamic behavior for operations that access objects by a specified index.
member.param: Provides information about the operation.

The indexes that are used in the operation. For example, for the sampleObject[3] = 10 operation in C# (sampleObject(3) = 10 in Visual Basic), where sampleObject is derived from the class, is equal to 3.

The value to set to the object that has the specified index. For example, for the sampleObject[3] = 10 operation in C# (sampleObject(3) = 10 in Visual Basic), where sampleObject is derived from the class, is equal to 10.
member.returns: true if the operation is successful; otherwise, false. If this method returns false, the run-time binder of the language determines the behavior. (In most cases, a language-specific run-time exception is thrown.

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.JsonObject.TrySetMember(System.Dynamic.SetMemberBinder,System.Object)
member.summary: Provides the implementation for operations that set member values. Classes derived from the class can override this method to specify dynamic behavior for operations such as setting a value for a property.
member.param: Provides information about the object that called the dynamic operation. The binder.Name property provides the name of the member to which the value is being assigned. For example, for the statement sampleObject.SampleProperty = "Test", where sampleObject is an instance of the class derived from the class, binder.Name returns "SampleProperty". The binder.IgnoreCase property specifies whether the member name is case-sensitive.
The value to set to the member. For example, for sampleObject.SampleProperty = "Test", where sampleObject is an instance of the class derived from the class, the is "Test".
member.returns: true if the operation is successful; otherwise, false. If this method returns false, the run-time binder of the language determines the behavior. (In most cases, a language-specific run-time exception is thrown.)

member.name: T:Elasticsearch.Net.SimpleJson
member.summary:
This class encodes and decodes JSON strings. Spec. details, see http://www.json.org/
JSON uses Arrays and Objects. These correspond here to the datatypes JsonArray(IList<object>) and JsonObject(IDictionary<string,object>). All numbers are parsed to doubles.
